title: Walgreens And Kroger Stop Selling E-Cigarettes Amid Health Crisis
description: The stores are the latest to stop selling the products as health officials probe a nationwide outbreak of lung illnesses and deaths.
nlp_summary:
Walgreens and Kroger are taking e-cigarettes off the shelves amid a nationwide outbreak of vaping-related lung illnesses and more than a dozen deaths linked to the habit.
In a statement on Monday, Walgreens said it will cease selling the products at its locations across the country as health officials continue to investigate the crisis.
In all of these cases, patients reported a history of vaping, most with products containing THC, the ingredient in marijuana that creates a high.
As federal, state and local agencies continue searching for answers, Michigan and New York have slapped temporary bans on flavored e-cigarettes.
In Massachusetts, a temporary ban encompasses all vaping products, both flavored and non-flavored in addition to those containing marijuana and THC.

title: Coca-Cola And Home Depot Oppose Georgia Push To Restrict Voting
description: Republicans in Georgia are trying to make it harder to vote, and the pressure is on big corporations to voice their dissent.
nlp_summary:
Coca-Cola and Home Depot, two major corporations based in Georgia, have voiced their opposition to the Republican-led effort to restrict access to voting in the state, The Washington Post reported Monday.
The Georgia Chamber of Commerce issued a statement to CNBC that expressed its ‚Äúconcern and opposition‚Äù to provisions in two bills, SB 241 and HB 531, that restrict voter access.
Voting rights advocates have called for stronger action from the chamber‚Äôs member companies, which include Coca-Cola, Home Depot, Aflac, UPS, Southern Co. and Delta Air Lines.
The two bills would institute sweeping changes to voter access, including stopping no-excuse mail-in voting, curtailing early voting on Sundays, limiting access to drop boxes and restricting early voting hours.
They‚Äôre among more than 250 pieces of legislation proposed in 43 states that would restrict voting.

(The company‚Äôs Kentucky Geek Squad City facility handles more serious repairs, including work like data recovery that could require them to sift through a customer‚Äôs data.)

At least one Geek Squad technician attempted to give the money back and was rebuffed.

That said, Congress is unlikely to act on the findings this year.
RECOMMENDATIONSThe report urged Congress to allow antitrust enforcers more leeway in stopping companies from purchasing potential rivals, something that is now difficult.
As part of the report, the committee staff drew up a menu of potential changes in antitrust law.
Reporting by Nandita Bose and Diane Bartz; Editing by Edward Tobin and Leslie Adler

title: Apple Becomes 1st US Company To Be Valued At $2 Trillion

Just five companies ‚Äî Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, Facebook and Google‚Äôs parent company ‚Äî account for nearly 23% of the S&P 500‚Äôs entire value.

The Saudi energy producer‚Äôs shares have fallen since amid a drop in oil prices and its market value is now about $1.82 trillion.

title: Fortnite Maker Sues Apple After Getting Kicked Off App Store

(Reuters) - Apple Inc on Thursday removed popular video game ‚ÄúFortnite‚Äù from its App Store for violating the company‚Äôs in-app payment guidelines, prompting developer Epic Games to file a lawsuit against the iPhone maker seeking to end its in-app payment practices.
The move came after Epic Games enabled a direct payment feature on the Fortnite app, which Apple said violated its in-app payment guidelines.
Analysts believe games are the biggest contributor to spending inside the App Store, which is in turn the largest component of Apple‚Äôs $46.3 billion-per-year services segment.
Mobile app data analysis firm SensorTower estimated that the game has been downloaded 2.4 million times in the last 30 days and generated $43.4 million on the App Store.
Since its release, SensorTower estimates, the game has reached 133.2 million installs and seen $1.2 billion in spending worldwide on Apple‚Äôs App Store alone.

title: Tech Giants May Be Profiting From Forced Labor Of Uighur Muslims In China: Report
description: OFILM, a tech supplier that employs Uighurs under highly restrictive conditions, touts customers like Apple, Samsung, Lenovo, Dell, HP, LG and Huawei.
nlp_summary:
NANCHANG, China (AP) ‚Äî In a lively Muslim quarter of Nanchang city, a sprawling Chinese factory turns out computer screens, cameras and fingerprint scanners for a supplier to international tech giants such as Apple and Lenovo.
At the OFILM factory, Uighurs are paid the same as other workers but otherwise treated differently, according to residents of the neighborhood.
‚ÄúThey think these people are poorly educated, isolated, backwards, can‚Äôt speak Mandarin,‚Äù said James Leibold, a scholar of Chinese ethnic policy at La Trobe University in Melbourne.
Another OFILM factory is located about half a mile away on a different street.
The report said it found ‚Äúconditions that strongly suggest forced labor‚Äù consistent with International Labor Organization definitions.

title: China Forcing Muslims To Work In Factories For Nike, Apple, Others: Report
description: The country has been heavily criticized for its program of detaining Uighur Muslims and other ethnic minorities in "reeducation" camps.
nlp_summary:
A disturbing new report claims that between 2017 and 2019, China coerced at least 80,000 Uighur Muslims and others from ethnic minority groups to work in factories across China that supply dozens of popular global brands.
One such factory, which employed around 600 ethnic minority workers from China‚Äôs western Xinjiang region as of January, produces more than 7 million Nike shoes annually.
Another factory that produces ‚Äúselfie cameras‚Äù for Apple iPhones took in 700 such workers in 2017.
The country claimed late last year that its detainees had ‚Äúgraduated.‚ÄùAccording to the report, however, some of the detainees were transferred directly from their camps to factories.
The Uighurs and Muslim minority workers are forbidden from participating in religious observances, forced to learn Mandarin and undergo ‚Äúideological training‚Äù outside of their normal work hours, the report states.

title: GameStop Soars Again; Wall Street Bends Under The Pressure
description: The video game retailer shot up nearly 70%, clawing back much of its steep loss from the day before.
nlp_summary:
Another bout of selling gripped the U.S. stock market Friday, as anxiety mounts over whether the frenzy behind a swift, meteoric rise in GameStop and a handful of other stocks will damage Wall Street overall.
The assault is directed squarely at hedge funds and other Wall Street titans that had bet the struggling video game retailer‚Äôs stock would fall.
Wall Street‚Äôs focus remains squarely on GameStop and other moonshot stocks.
After their success with GameStop, traders have been looking for other downtrodden stocks in the market where hedge funds and other Wall Street firms are betting on price drops.
These last few weeks I‚Äôve started caring again; feeling impassioned again; wanting more again.‚ÄùMost of Wall Street and other market watchers say they expect the smaller-pocketed investors who are pushing up GameStop to eventually get burned.

title: Reddit, GameStop And Wall Street: Here‚Äôs Everything You Need To Know

title: California Tesla Driver Arrested While Riding In Backseat

nlp_summary:
OAKLAND, Calif. (AP) ‚Äî A motorist was arrested after an officer observed him in the backseat of a Tesla traveling on a San Francisco Bay Area freeway, the California Highway Patrol said.
Param Sharma, 25, was arrested for alleged reckless driving and disobeying a peace officer, the highway patrol said in a statement Tuesday.
Multiple 911 calls Monday evening reported a person seated in the backseat of a Tesla Model 3 without anyone in the driver‚Äôs seat while the vehicle traveled on Interstate 80 across the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge.
Tesla has a system to monitor drivers to make sure they‚Äôre paying attention by detecting force from hands on the steering wheel.
The KTVU television station reported that Sharma said in an interview that riding in the backseat isn‚Äôt dangerous and he will continue it.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has begun 27 investigations ‚Äî with 23 ongoing ‚Äî into crashes that may have involved Tesla‚Äôs Autopilot feature.

title: Tesla Just Joined The S&P 500 Index ‚Äï Here's Why That's A Big Deal
description: Tesla is the sixth-largest company to join the S&P 500. But what does that mean, exactly?
nlp_summary:
Despite the fact that the U.S. economy entered a recession earlier this year, the stock market has been on fire.
Here‚Äôs a closer look at how the S&P 500 works and why its inclusion of Tesla is such a big deal.
To get a sense of what the overall stock market is doing, we can look to several stock market indexes.
Perhaps the best-known is the S&P 500 Index, a market capitalization-weighted index of 505 U.S. large-cap stocks across 11 sectors.
Other major players in the S&P 500 Index include Microsoft, Facebook and Amazon.

title: Trump Tweets Support For Tesla Reopening During Deadly Pandemic
description: The president supported Tesla founder Elon Musk for reopening a factory in defiance of health guidelines in Alameda County, California.
nlp_summary:
Even as reported coronavirus cases spike in multiple U.S. states, President Donald Trump has expressed support for people and businesses that break local social distancing guidelines and defy the advice of health officials in his own administration.
Trump‚Äôs support for these businesses tracks with reporting from various outlets that his administration believes a swift end to social distancing measures will revive the faltering economy and improve his reelection chances.
In recent years, multiple employees have publicly complained about working conditions at the Alameda Tesla factory, and in 2019, a judge ruled that Musk had illegally tried to sabotage efforts to unionize there.
In April, Trump posted tweets calling for the ‚Äúliberation‚Äù of Minnesota, Michigan and Virginia as sparse groups of protestors ‚Äï some of whom were armed ‚Äï gathered in each state to demand an end to social distancing guidelines.
On May 5, Trump said Americans ‚Äúshould think of themselves as warriors‚Äù as he encouraged them to return to work.

In the California governor‚Äôs press conference Monday, Newsom said he had ‚Äúlong been a strong advocate and supporter‚Äù of the tech company.

title: Walmart Says Tesla's Solar Panels Caught Fire On Multiple Store Roofs
description: The retail giant is suing Tesla alleging breach of contract after fires on the roofs of at least seven stores.
nlp_summary:
Walmart has claimed in a lawsuit that Tesla-supplied solar panels on the roofs at several of its stores caught fire because of the tech company‚Äôs ‚Äúwidespread, systemic negligence‚Äù and its ‚Äúfailure to live up to industry standards.‚ÄùThe retail giant is suing Tesla alleging breach of contract after fires on the roofs of at least seven Walmart stores with solar panels installed by Tesla‚Äôs solar business.
Walmart is seeking damages from Tesla and is demanding the company remove all of its solar panels from its stores.

title: Toyota Calls Off EPA Partnership Under Pressure From Environmentalists
description: The plan to hire the automaker to overhaul internal practices at an agency that regulates it drew fire from former EPA officials and watchdog groups.
nlp_summary:
Toyota Motor Corp. has ended talks with the Environmental Protection Agency to overhaul internal management practices at the agency, the automaker told HuffPost on Wednesday.
‚ÄúWe were always just in talks anyway, so it was not a done deal,‚Äù Karen Nielsen, a Toyota spokeswoman, told HuffPost by phone.
The announcement drew swift criticism from former EPA officials and environmentalists who told HuffPost at the time that the partnership represented ‚Äúa clear conflict of interest.‚Äù The EPA directly regulates Toyota, and the automaker has lobbied aggressively to weaken Obama-era fuel economy standards.
On Dec. 13, the Environmental Working Group sent a letter to Toyota North America CEO James Lentz, recommending he abandon talks with the EPA or risk damaging the company‚Äôs reputation.
Nielsen declined to comment on whether pressure from EWG factored into Toyota‚Äôs decision on working with the EPA.

Gregg DeGuire via Getty Images Michael Avenatti famously represented porn star Stormy Daniels in lawsuits against then-President Donald Trump.
Avenatti, 50, reached the height of his fame in 2018 as he represented porn star Stormy Daniels in lawsuits against then-President Donald Trump.
Months later, he was charged with defrauding Daniels of hundreds of thousands of dollars she was owed for a book deal.

title: China Forcing Muslims To Work In Factories For Nike, Apple, Others: Report
description: The country has been heavily criticized for its program of detaining Uighur Muslims and other ethnic minorities in "reeducation" camps.
nlp_summary:
A disturbing new report claims that between 2017 and 2019, China coerced at least 80,000 Uighur Muslims and others from ethnic minority groups to work in factories across China that supply dozens of popular global brands.
One such factory, which employed around 600 ethnic minority workers from China‚Äôs western Xinjiang region as of January, produces more than 7 million Nike shoes annually.
Another factory that produces ‚Äúselfie cameras‚Äù for Apple iPhones took in 700 such workers in 2017.
The country claimed late last year that its detainees had ‚Äúgraduated.‚ÄùAccording to the report, however, some of the detainees were transferred directly from their camps to factories.
The Uighurs and Muslim minority workers are forbidden from participating in religious observances, forced to learn Mandarin and undergo ‚Äúideological training‚Äù outside of their normal work hours, the report states.

Another factory that produces ‚Äúselfie cameras‚Äù for Apple iPhones took in 700 such workers in 2017.
The country claimed late last year that its detainees had ‚Äúgraduated.‚ÄùAccording to the report, however, some of the detainees were transferred directly from their camps to factories.
The Uighurs and Muslim minority workers are forbidden from participating in religious observances, forced to learn Mandarin and undergo ‚Äúideological training‚Äù outside of their normal work hours, the report states.

title: FedEx Calls On Washington NFL Team To Change Racist Name
description: Meanwhile, Nike appeared to remove all of its apparel featuring the NFL team's logos from its website.

FedEx is the first corporate sponsor to call on Washington, D.C.‚Äôs NFL team to change its racist name.
In a brief statement published to the league‚Äôs website on Thursday, FedEx said: ‚ÄúWe have communicated to the team in Washington our request that they change the team name.‚ÄùThe shipping giant owns the naming rights to the team‚Äôs home stadium in Washington.

title: China Forcing Muslims To Work In Factories For Nike, Apple, Others: Report
description: The country has been heavily criticized for its program of detaining Uighur Muslims and other ethnic minorities in "reeducation" camps.
nlp_summary:
A disturbing new report claims that between 2017 and 2019, China coerced at least 80,000 Uighur Muslims and others from ethnic minority groups to work in factories across China that supply dozens of popular global brands.
One such factory, which employed around 600 ethnic minority workers from China‚Äôs western Xinjiang region as of January, produces more than 7 million Nike shoes annually.
Another factory that produces ‚Äúselfie cameras‚Äù for Apple iPhones took in 700 such workers in 2017.
The country claimed late last year that its detainees had ‚Äúgraduated.‚ÄùAccording to the report, however, some of the detainees were transferred directly from their camps to factories.
The Uighurs and Muslim minority workers are forbidden from participating in religious observances, forced to learn Mandarin and undergo ‚Äúideological training‚Äù outside of their normal work hours, the report states.

title: Avenatti Lawyers Seek Leniency In Nike Extortion, Say He's Constantly Shamed
description: The once high-flying attorney faces constant ridicule after his ‚Äúcataclysmic fall‚Äù and should spend no more than six months behind bars, his attorneys said.
nlp_summary:
Probation Department calculated federal sentencing guidelines to call for a sentence of 11 to 14 years in prison, Avenatti‚Äôs lawyers noted.
The lawyers said no more than six months in prison and a year of home confinement was appropriate.
Gregg DeGuire via Getty Images Michael Avenatti famously represented porn star Stormy Daniels in lawsuits against then-President Donald Trump.
Avenatti, 50, reached the height of his fame in 2018 as he represented porn star Stormy Daniels in lawsuits against then-President Donald Trump.
Months later, he was charged with defrauding Daniels of hundreds of thousands of dollars she was owed for a book deal.

title: Vanessa Bryant Slams Nike For 'Mambacita' Shoe Appearing Online Without Her Approval
description: Kobe Bryant's widow said she worked with the brand on the sneakers in honor of her late daughter Gianna, but never approved their release.
nlp_summary:
Vanessa Bryant had some choice words for Nike after a shoe she designed with the company appeared to have been released without her approval.
The wife of late NBA star Kobe Bryant posted a note on Instagram Thursday explaining that she designed a shoe for her daughter Gianna ‚ÄúGigi‚Äù Bryant, who died tragically in the same helicopter crash that killed Kobe Bryant in January 2020.
Her collaboration with Nike in honor of the 13-year-old took place before Bryant elected not to renew the partnership her husband had with the brand.
It was going to be called the MAMBACITA shoe as an exclusive black and white colorway on her daddy‚Äôs shoes.
We will always do everything we can to honor Kobe and Gigi‚Äôs legacies.

title: Nike Sues Company Pumping Out Lil Nas X's 'Satan Shoes'

title: El Paso Walmart Shooting Survivor Deported While Helping Investigators: Attorney
description: The woman was reportedly in the process of obtaining a special visa, because of her help as a witness to the 2019 shooting, when she was deported followi...
nlp_summary:
Wang Ying/Xinhua via Getty Crosses with names of victims are placed near the Walmart center where a massive shooting took place in El Paso, Texas, on Aug. 5, 2019.
A survivor of the 2019 mass shooting at an El Paso, Texas, Walmart, who has been helping law enforcement as a witness to the deadly attack that killed 22 people, has been deported following a traffic stop, her attorneys said.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement then deported her on Friday to Mexico, El Paso station KTSM reported.
ASSOCIATED PRESS Texas state police cars are seen at the El Paso Walmart where a gunman opened fire and killed 22 people on Aug. 3, 2019.

title: Walmart Apologizes For 'Mistakenly' Calling GOP Senator A 'Sore Loser' On Twitter

after its official corporate account tweeted that he was a ‚Äúsore loser‚Äù for planning to object to the presidential election certification process during a joint congressional session next week.

title: TikTok Owner Says It Wasn't Aware Deal Included $5 Billion 'Education Fund'
description: ByteDance on Sunday said it was unaware of President Trump's plan to use $5 billion from the company's sale to fund so-called "patriotic education" in th...
nlp_summary:
ByteDance, the China-based company that owns video-sharing app TikTok, said it was not told that $5 billion of its deal with Walmart and Oracle would go to President Donald Trump‚Äôs so-called ‚Äúpatriotic education‚Äù initiative.
In recent months and with a presidential election looming, Trump has leaned heavily into racist rhetoric as a tool to excite his largely white base.
Trump on Friday announced the formation of the ‚Äú1776 Commission‚Äù as a reaction to efforts to include lessons about slavery and racism in America‚Äôs schools, such as The New York Times‚Äô 1619 Project.
Numerous schools have incorporated content from the project, created by reporter Nikole Hannah-Jones, in an effort to improve their teaching about the role of race in American history.
Conservative media and Republican lawmakers across the U.S. have expressed outrage that the project‚Äôs revelations about the history of racism do not portray the country in a positive light, with some even calling it propaganda.

title: Walmart, Amazon Donate To QAnon-Promoting Tennessee Politician
description: The corporate backing for lawmakers supporting QAnon content shows how the conspiracy theory is penetrating mainstream politics.
nlp_summary:
Walmart, Amazon, and other corporate giants donated money to the reelection campaign of a Tennessee state lawmaker who had used social media to amplify and promote the QAnon conspiracy theory, according to an Associated Press review of campaign finance records and the candidate‚Äôs posts.
Dozens of QAnon-promoting candidates have run for federal or state offices during this election cycle.
Unlike state Rep. Susan Lynn, who chairs the Tennessee House finance committee, few are incumbents who can attract corporate PAC money.
In July, AT&T Tennessee PAC, Cigna Corporation PAC and Jack Daniel‚Äôs PAC contributed a total of $4,000 to Lynn‚Äôs campaign.
___Associated Press data journalist Andrew Milligan in New Haven, Connecticut; and Adrian Sainz in Memphis, Tennessee, contributed to this report.

title: Minnesota Couple Wears Nazi Face Masks To Walmart After State Mask Mandate
description: A woman seen wearing the mask insisted that she is "not a Nazi" and that she was making a political statement.
nlp_summary:
Walmart temporarily banned a couple after the pair wore swastika face masks into a Minnesota store in what they claimed was a political statement in the wake of a statewide mask mandate.
‚ÄúWe literally had a war about this.‚ÄùThis couple wore Nazi flags around their faces inside a Walmart in Marshall, MN to protest the statewide mask mandate that took effect today.
They issued a notice of trespass to the couple, who were identified only as a man, 59, and a woman, 64.
Shopper Raphaela Mueller, who posted the couple‚Äôs photo and video to Facebook, said she was born and raised in Germany.
Walmart has required shoppers to wear masks inside its Minnesota stores since July 20 in an effort to decrease the spread of COVID-19.

title: Walmart Will Be Closed Thanksgiving Day To Honor Workers Amid COVID-19 Crisis
description: Retail experts say the Arkansas-based company's decision is an early sign of how the coronavirus will impact Black Friday shopping.
nlp_summary:
Walmart also said Tuesday that it will be giving out another round of bonuses for workers on the front lines of the coronavirus.
The company said that it will be doling out $300 for full-time hourly workers and $150 for part-time hourly and temporary workers.
Drivers, managers and assistant managers in stores, clubs, distribution centers and fulfillment centers and health and wellness will also receive a bonus.
The bonuses will be included in Aug. 20 paychecks for eligible workers employed as of July 31.
‚ÄúOur associates have been working at an incredible pace, they‚Äôve solved problems, and they‚Äôve set an amazing example for others,‚Äù said John Furner, president and CEO of Walmart U.S., in a corporate blog post.

title: Walmart To Finally Require All Customers To Wear Masks

To help bring consistency across stores and clubs, we will require all shoppers to wear a face covering starting Monday, July 20.
These individuals ‚Äúwill work with customers who show up at a store without a face covering to try and find a solution.‚Äù‚ÄúWe know it may not be possible for everyone to wear a face covering.
The brand‚Äôs sister store, Sam‚Äôs Club, will also be requiring customers to wear masks.
Walmart follows suit with other major chains like Starbucks and Best Buy, which have all announced in the last few weeks that they will be requiring customers to wear facial coverings upon entry into stores.

title: Shooting At Walmart Distribution Center In California Leaves 2 Dead
description: The shooting by a 31-year-old man with a semi-automatic rifle started about 3:30 p.m. Saturday.
nlp_summary:
RED BLUFF, Calif (AP) ‚Äî A man drove into a Northern California distribution center and started shooting at people, killing an employee and wounding four others before he was killed by police, authorities said.
The shooting by a 31-year-old man with a semi-automatic rifle started about 3:30 p.m. Saturday at the Walmart distribution center south of Red Bluff, a city of about 14,000 people about 131 miles (210 kilometers) north of Sacramento, California.
Officials did not identify the shooter, but Johnston said he has a history with the Red Bluff workplace.
The shooting victims were taken to St. Elizabeth Community Hospital in Red Bluff, spokeswoman Allison Hendrickson told The Associated Press.
Neither was hurt, but his wife told him not to come to the front entrance, the newspaper reported.

title: Attorneys General Say Walmart Is Failing To Protect Workers, Customers From Coronavirus

title: El Paso Walmart Mass Shooting Suspect Pleads Not Guilty In 22 Deaths
description: Police have said the 21-year-old man confessed to the Aug. 3 Texas mass shooting and that he targeted Mexicans.
nlp_summary:
EL PASO, Texas (AP) ‚Äî The 21-year-old man charged with capital murder in the fatal shooting of 22 people at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, pleaded not guilty Thursday during a brief initial hearing.
Police have said Patrick Crusius of Dallas confessed to the Aug. 3 mass shooting and that he targeted Mexicans.
Around 80 members of the public crammed into the courtroom on the top floor of the El Paso County Courthouse to witness his first appearance.
In documents filed Thursday, the El Paso prosecutor notified the court that he had shared evidence with the defense on Sept. 27.
The court records also included medical images taken from shooting victims, and jail mail and phone calls involving Crisius after his arrest.

title: How Employers Make It Impossible For Working Women To Breastfeed
description: A HuffPost investigation shows many low-wage workers are confined to filthy bathrooms, can't get breaks and even lose their jobs trying to pump.
nlp_summary:
In slightly more than half the cases, employers violated the requirement that they provide adequate space for pumping.
The hurdles to pumping at work took a financial, emotional and physical toll on many of the women.
Employers illegally retaliated against workers for asserting their rights in 22 cases, including the Walmart case in Carson City.
In many restaurant cases, workers who asked for time to pump were told there was no one to cover for them.
Women have to weigh their desire to breastfeed against their relationship with their boss, hope for a promotion, or even their job itself.

title: Walmart To End E-Cigarette Sales, Citing Growing Nationwide 'Uncertainty'
description: The company's decision follows a wave of vaping-linked illnesses ‚Äî and several deaths ‚Äî throughout the nation.
nlp_summary:
Walmart has announced it will stop selling e-cigarettes amid a national outbreak of vaping-linked lung disease and a growing number of deaths.
On Thursday, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention confirmed that the number of vaping-related lung illnesses had climbed to at least 530, which were reported from 38 states and one U.S. territory.
All individuals had a history of e-cigarette use, and most of those vapes contained THC, the marijuana ingredient that creates a high.
Federal, state and local health officials are continuing to investigate the cases, as no specific cause has yet been identified, and no particular product has been connected to all of the illnesses.
The CDC is urging those concerned over the risks to refrain from using e-cigarettes until more is known.

title: Walmart Says It Will Stop Selling Handgun Ammunition
description: The announcement follows a string of mass shootings in the last month, one of which occurred at a Walmart store.
nlp_summary:
Walmart said Tuesday it would discontinue the sale of handgun ammunition.
The announcements come in the wake of three mass shootings in the last month, including one that took place at a Walmart store in El Paso, Texas.
Walmart said it would stop selling short-barrel rifle ammunition, including the .223 caliber and 5.56 mm ammunition sometimes used in high-capacity magazines on assault-style weapons.
The company also said it would discontinue handgun sales in Alaska, the only remaining state where Walmart sells handguns.
The CEO noted that the changes will allow Walmart to focus solely on hunting rifles and shotguns and related ammunition.

title: Senate Passes Legislation To Support Victims Of Mysterious ‚ÄòHavana Syndrome‚Äô

The Senate on Monday unanimously passed a new bill that would give additional federal support to Americans experiencing brain injuries affiliated with the mysterious ‚ÄúHavana Syndrome.‚ÄùThe legislation, called the Helping American Victims Afflicted by Neurological Attacks (HAVANA Act), would give federal agencies the authority to provide financial and medical support to those impacted by the incidents.
The mysterious illnesses first emerged in Havana, Cuba in 2016 after dozens of staff at the U.S. Embassy suffered symptoms including headaches, dizziness, tinnitus and visual and hearing problems.
Similar cases were later reported in Guangzhou, China, drawing concern that Americans overseas were being targeted.
The report, however, did not detail if the exposure was intentional or if it had been released by American adversaries.

‚ÄúIf an infant doesn‚Äôt wear a mask, then no one should wear a mask,‚Äù says Gomez in her livestream, before adding: ‚ÄúPeople looking at us like, ‚ÄòWhat‚Äôs going on?‚Äô Isn‚Äôt it crazy how people now look at me like we crazy because we don‚Äôt have a mask on?
‚ÄúIf you want to wear a mask and think [it] makes you safer ... That‚Äôs absolutely your right, 100%.
‚ÄúYou literally cannot mandate somebody to wear a mask knowing that that mask is killing people,‚Äù she said.

title: Senate Passes Legislation To Support Victims Of Mysterious ‚ÄòHavana Syndrome‚Äô
description: Sen. Susan Collins said government officials should be treated the "same way we would treat a soldier who suffered a traumatic injury on the battlefield.‚Äù
nlp_summary:
The Senate on Monday unanimously passed a new bill that would give additional federal support to Americans experiencing brain injuries affiliated with the mysterious ‚ÄúHavana Syndrome.‚ÄùThe legislation, called the Helping American Victims Afflicted by Neurological Attacks (HAVANA Act), would give federal agencies the authority to provide financial and medical support to those impacted by the incidents.
The mysterious illnesses first emerged in Havana, Cuba in 2016 after dozens of staff at the U.S. Embassy suffered symptoms including headaches, dizziness, tinnitus and visual and hearing problems.
Similar cases were later reported in Guangzhou, China, drawing concern that Americans overseas were being targeted.
The report, however, did not detail if the exposure was intentional or if it had been released by American adversaries.
The House could take up companion legislation on the HAVANA Act soon.

title: FBI Director Christopher Wray: Don't Pay Ransomeware Payments After Cyberattacks
description: In the past month, major companies have participated in multimillion-dollar transactions¬†aimed at getting their systems back online.
nlp_summary:
‚ÄúIt is our policy, it is our guidance, from the FBI, that companies should not pay the ransom for a number of reasons,‚Äù Christopher Wray testified under questioning from members of the House Judiciary Committee.
Besides the fact that such payments can encourage additional cyberattacks, victims may not automatically get back their data despite forking over millions, ‚Äúand that‚Äôs not unknown to happen,‚Äù Wray said.
(Photo by Caroline Brehman/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images)In ransomware attacks, hackers lock up and encrypt a victim‚Äôs data and demand a payment in order to return it.
They have proliferated in scale over the past year, targeting not just hospitals and police agencies but also critical infrastructure and vital industries.
The Justice Department has said it was able to recover the majority of the ransomware payment after locating the virtual wallet used by the hackers.

Costco is the latest retailer to stop selling coconut milk allegedly made with forced monkey labor in Thailand, according to the animal rights group People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals.
PETA said that the big box store agreed to stop selling certain brands of milk from coconuts it alleges was picked by monkeys that were chained, abused and exploited.
Since then, retailers including Walgreens, Food Lion and Stop & Shop ceased stocking implicated brands of coconut milk, including Chaokoh, according to USA Today.
‚ÄúWe will continue to monitor the implementation of the harvest policies and once satisfied will resume purchasing.‚ÄùAphisak Theppadungporn, managing director of Thai coconut milk producer Theppadungporn Coconut Co. Ltd., in July denied the allegations of forced monkey labor to Reuters.
The company has been auditing plantations since January and has yet to find one that used monkeys, Theppadungporn told Reuters.

Many students across the United States face a technological disadvantage that threatens to undermine their educational and professional opportunities.
Nearly 5 million students in K-12 public schools don‚Äôt have access to internet speeds required for effective digital learning, and many more lack the skills needed to be ready for tomorrow‚Äôs workforce.
For those with limited connectivity and technology, the digital divide can become a digital wall.
Since 2014, the Verizon Innovative Learning Schools (VILS) program has bridged the divide between students and access to the tech they need.
By supporting digital inclusion initiatives, Verizon enables individuals and communities to develop the knowledge and skills to thrive in the digital age.

title: Fire Department Joins Net Neutrality Suit After Verizon Cuts Data During Wildfire

title: AT&T Signs Deal To Combine Media Operations, Including CNN, With Discovery
description: AT&T will combine its massive media operations that include CNN HBO, TNT and TBS in a $43 billion deal with Discovery
nlp_summary:
NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî AT&T will combine its massive media operations that include CNN, HBO, TNT and TBS in a $43 billion deal with Discovery, the owner of lifestyle networks including the Food Network and HGTV.
HBO Max and HBO have a combined U.S. subscriber base of about 44 million, and Discovery+ has about 15 million subscribers.
In the all-stock deal, AT&T will receive $43 billion in a combination of cash, debt securities, and WarnerMedia‚Äôs retention of certain debt.
AT&T shareholders will receive stock representing 71% of the new company and Discovery stockholders will own 29% of the new company.
The new company‚Äôs board will have 13 members, seven will initially appointed by AT&T, including the chairperson.

title: Senate Passes Legislation To Support Victims Of Mysterious ‚ÄòHavana Syndrome‚Äô
description: Sen. Susan Collins said government officials should be treated the "same way we would treat a soldier who suffered a traumatic injury on the battlefield.‚Äù
nlp_summary:
The Senate on Monday unanimously passed a new bill that would give additional federal support to Americans experiencing brain injuries affiliated with the mysterious ‚ÄúHavana Syndrome.‚ÄùThe legislation, called the Helping American Victims Afflicted by Neurological Attacks (HAVANA Act), would give federal agencies the authority to provide financial and medical support to those impacted by the incidents.
The mysterious illnesses first emerged in Havana, Cuba in 2016 after dozens of staff at the U.S. Embassy suffered symptoms including headaches, dizziness, tinnitus and visual and hearing problems.
Similar cases were later reported in Guangzhou, China, drawing concern that Americans overseas were being targeted.
The report, however, did not detail if the exposure was intentional or if it had been released by American adversaries.
The House could take up companion legislation on the HAVANA Act soon.

title: AT&T Raises Prices After Saying Merger Would Make Things Cheaper For Consumers
description: DirecTV Now customers will be affected by the price hike.
nlp_summary:
AT&T, which recently acquired Time Warner in a landmark merger, is hiking up the prices for some DirecTV customers, even after telling a federal judge earlier this year that the merger could lower prices for its customers.
AT&T‚Äôs DirecTV Now price increase begins on July 26 for new customers and, according to USA Today, it‚Äôs not the company‚Äôs only price hike.
The Justice Department attempted to block AT&T‚Äôs purchase of Time Warner in federal court, arguing in an antitrust case that the merger would create a media monopoly and lead to higher prices for both AT&T customers and other cable providers that serve Time Warner content.
Three weeks ago, Judge Richard Leon sided with AT&T, allowing the telecom giant to move forward with its $85.4 billion deal to acquire Time Warner.
The acquisition gives AT&T ownership of HBO, Warner Bros. film and television studios, DC Entertainment, Cartoon Network, TBS, CNN and the cable network giant Turner Broadcasting.

title: The AT&T-Time Warner Megamerger Sets A Dangerous Precedent
description: The floodgates are open for further corporate consolidation.
nlp_summary:
It seemed that Trump was motivated by his loathing of CNN, which is owned by Time Warner.
But mergers like this one will have plenty of pernicious side effects that can sicken the U.S. economy.
Big, powerful companies can strike better deals with suppliers, deals that smaller and newer competitors can‚Äôt beat.
Luigi Zingales, a finance professor at the University of Chicago‚Äôs Booth School of Business, argues in a working paper that the more market power companies gobble up, the more political power they accrue.
Corporate dealmaking was already riding high before this decision, but the big merger bonanza, it seems, was only getting started.

nlp_summary:
According to documents obtained by The Washington Post, Cohen was hired just days after Trump was sworn into office at a rate of $50,000 a month for all of 2017 to advise AT&T on multiple matters pending before the government.
The $85 billion AT&T-Time Warner merger is currently pending before the Justice Department, which has sued to stop it from going forward.
It‚Äôs unclear how Avenatti obtained the documents detailing Cohen‚Äôs finances, but they have since been confirmed by multiple media outlets.
He was specifically told not to work as a lobbyist for the telecom.
Cohen is currently under investigation by the FBI, which conducted raids on his home, office and hotel room last month.

title: What Did AT&T And Novartis Get For The Money They Paid Trump's Lawyer?
description: The most innocent explanation of the payments to Michael Cohen's LLC is still pretty sketchy.
nlp_summary:
The company told Bloomberg it paid Cohen one $150,000 payment for advice on what the outlet refers to as local accounting standards.
AT&T paid Cohen four installments of $50,000 from early 2017 to January 2018.
Avenatti said on MSNBC Tuesday night that he knew ‚Äúfor a fact‚Äù there were three Suspicious Activity Reports filed with the Treasury Department by a bank that handled money paid to Cohen‚Äôs LLC.
At least $4.4 million flowed through Cohen‚Äôs LLC between just before Trump‚Äôs election through January, the New York Times reported.
This article has been updated with more recently reported figures for the amount paid to Cohen by AT&T.

title: AT&T Hired Firm Linked To Michael Cohen To Get The Inside Scoop On Trump
description: The arrangement illustrates efforts by the telecom to work with an influential adviser to the new president as his administration took up major industry ...
nlp_summary:
Jonathan Ernst / Reuters "Essential Consultants was one of several firms we engaged in early 2017 to provide insights into understanding the new administration," AT&T said in a statement.
The company is linked to Trump lawyer Michael Cohen.
Avenatti‚Äôs report said AT&T had paid $200,000 in four equal payments to Essential Consultants between Oct, 3, 2017 and Jan. 3, 2018.
‚ÄúEssential Consultants was one of several firms we engaged in early 2017 to provide insights into understanding the new administration,‚Äù AT&T said in a statement.
The Wall Street Journal released a 2016 Delaware certificate of formation for Essential Consultants that was signed by Michael Cohen.

title: Senate Passes Legislation To Support Victims Of Mysterious ‚ÄòHavana Syndrome‚Äô
description: Sen. Susan Collins said government officials should be treated the "same way we would treat a soldier who suffered a traumatic injury on the battlefield.‚Äù
nlp_summary:
The Senate on Monday unanimously passed a new bill that would give additional federal support to Americans experiencing brain injuries affiliated with the mysterious ‚ÄúHavana Syndrome.‚ÄùThe legislation, called the Helping American Victims Afflicted by Neurological Attacks (HAVANA Act), would give federal agencies the authority to provide financial and medical support to those impacted by the incidents.
The mysterious illnesses first emerged in Havana, Cuba in 2016 after dozens of staff at the U.S. Embassy suffered symptoms including headaches, dizziness, tinnitus and visual and hearing problems.
Similar cases were later reported in Guangzhou, China, drawing concern that Americans overseas were being targeted.
The report, however, did not detail if the exposure was intentional or if it had been released by American adversaries.
The House could take up companion legislation on the HAVANA Act soon.

title: Democrats Reintroduce Bill To Protect Abortion As Reproductive Rights Are Under Attack
description: The Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act would bar states from imposing restrictions on abortion, as Republicans push hundreds of anti-abortion bills at the sta...
nlp_summary:
Democrats are reintroducing legislation to protect people‚Äôs access to abortion, just as Republicans at the state-level push dozens of bills trying to limit access to reproductive rights and the Supreme Court is set to consider a pivotal case.
The Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act, first introduced by Sen. Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.) in 2013, would block states from imposing restrictions on abortion that make it harder for pregnant people to access care.
It would protect both a person‚Äôs right to determine if they want to continue a pregnancy, and health providers‚Äô ability to offer reproductive health care services.
It‚Äôs time for Congress to protect this constitutional right & pass the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act.
#ActForAbortionAccess https://t.co/ggAqyGVv7C ‚Äî Richard Blumenthal (@SenBlumenthal) June 8, 2021The Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act, first introduced by Blumenthal in 2013, has repeatedly been reintroduced in new congressional sessions since.

title: Why Is It A Good Thing If You Don‚Äôt ‚ÄúFit In‚Äù At Work?
description: Citigroup CEO Mike Corbat sits down with Farjana Rohman, Citi Vice President - Instant Payments Product Manager, to discuss the challenges of being a sta...
nlp_summary:
Ten years into her career in finance, an industry dominated by Ivy League degrees, she still frequently feels like an outsider.
But she now realizes that having a different perspective is not a bad thing.
As the Product Manager for Instant Payments at Citi, Rohman also feels that her distinct experience has enriched her work.

According to a lawsuit filed last week by the girl‚Äôs mother, Shirelle Thomas, the 14-year-old suffered second-degree burns on her abdomen and lower body in July 2017 after she was served water at an ‚Äúunreasonably dangerous temperature.‚ÄùThe alleged incident is believed to have occurred at a franchise in the Madras area, southeast of Portland, The Willamette Week reported.
In a statement that McDonald‚Äôs provided to HuffPost, owner Paul Rodby said that while there would be no further comment ‚Äúon pending litigation,‚Äù ‚Äúthe health and safety of our crew and customers are a top priority.‚ÄùMany in the media have drawn comparisons between the incident and the 1992 case of Liebeck v. McDonald‚Äôs, in which 79-year-old Stella Liebeck sued the fast food chain after she was severely burned by a cup of coffee purchased at a drive-through.
This story has been updated with a statement from McDonald‚Äôs.

title: McDonald's Workers Strike Over Sexual Harassment In The Workplace
description: The strike comes after the TIME‚ÄôS UP Legal Defense Fund filed 10 sexual harassment complaints on behalf of women employed by the fast-food giant.
nlp_summary:
McDonald‚Äôs workers in 10 U.S. cities began a strike on Tuesday to demand that their employer do more to combat sexual harassment in the workplace.
Tuesday‚Äôs strike comes four months after the TIME‚ÄôS UP Legal Defense Fund filed 10 sexual harassment charges with the U.S.
McDonalds workers are on strike against sexual harassment to raise awareness, hold them accountable, and push for better resources when issues arise.
At the @McDonalds HQ for @MsMagazine w/ restaurant workers and activists to say #metoo and demand that McD ends workplace sexual harassment.

title: Ellen DeGeneres Surprises McDonald's Pranksters Pushing For Asian Inclusion
description: The two Texas students say "Crazy Rich Asians" helped inspire a fake ad they created.

Two Texas college students who pulled off a headline-making prank on a local McDonald‚Äôs franchise this summer got a life-changing surprise on ‚ÄúThe Ellen DeGeneres Show‚Äù Monday.
Earlier this month, Jevh Maravilla and Christian Toldeo became viral superstars because of a mock poster they created and hung on the wall of a McDonald‚Äôs restaurant in Pearland, Texas.
i noticed there was a blank wall at mcdonald‚Äôs so i decided to make this fake poster of me and my friend.
Their cheeky antics, they said, were aimed at highlighting a lack of Asian representation in mainstream advertising, much as ‚ÄúCrazy Rich Asians‚Äù did for Hollywood films.
By the end of the interview, DeGeneres presented the guys with some colorful fan art of herself to sneak into their local McDonald‚Äôs.

title: McDonald‚Äôs Workers To Stage Strike Against Workplace Sexual Harassment
description: Organizers say it will be the first multistate strike in the U.S. specifically targeting sexual harassment.

NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Emboldened by the #MeToo movement, McDonald‚Äôs workers have voted to stage a one-day strike next week at restaurants in 10 cities in hopes of pressuring management to take stronger steps against on-the-job sexual harassment.
Organizers say it will be the first multistate strike in the U.S. specifically targeting sexual harassment.
Equal Employment Opportunity Commission in May alleging pervasive harassment at some of McDonald‚Äôs franchise restaurants.

The McDonald‚Äôs restaurant in Glastonbury, Connecticut, reportedly unveiled the new sign about three weeks ago.
Some believe the McDonald‚Äôs is sending a message to the neighboring Chick-fil-A franchise.

I feel that is a huge step for them,‚Äù Tina Manus of Stratford told NBC Connecticut.

title: McDonald's Salads Are Making People Sick
description: A fecal parasite found in McDonald's salads has made at least 163 sick, and three are hospitalized.
nlp_summary:
A food and waterborne parasite known as cyclospora cayetanensis has turned up in McDonald‚Äôs salads across nine states, sickening 163 people and hospitalizing three.
McDonald‚Äôs ceased selling salads in eateries in those states and in five others that had been getting lettuce blends from the same distributor, ‚Äúout of an abundance of caution‚Äù earlier this month, the chain said.
In addition to the nine states, McDonald‚Äôs in Indiana, Michigan, Montana, North Dakota, and West Virginia also received lettuce from a Fresh Express production facility in Streamwood, Illinois, which McDonald‚Äôs told USA Today is implicated in the outbreak.
‚ÄúThe health and safety of our customers and the people who work in McDonald‚Äôs restaurants is always our top priority,‚Äù the company said in a statement last week.
According to the FDA, symptoms include diarrhea, loss of appetite, weight loss, stomach cramps/pain, bloating, increased gas, nausea and fatigue.

title: McDonald's Plans To Take Cheeseburgers And Chocolate Milk Off Happy Meal Menu
description: The chain will implement a few other changes as well.
nlp_summary:
Bernard Weil via Getty Images By June, McDonald's featured Happy Meals will be combinations that are 600 calories or fewer.
McDonald‚Äôs Happy Meals are getting a makeover.
On Thursday, the global fast-food chain announced it is going to make worldwide changes to cut calories, sodium, saturated fat and sugar in its Happy Meals.
The company said that by June, its Happy Meal menu that‚Äôs on display in U.S. locations will feature only combinations that have 600 calories or fewer.
The company plans to do this by taking the cheeseburger off the Happy Meal menu altogether.

title: McDonald's Says Its Packaging Will Be 100 Percent Green By 2025
description: All of its restaurants will also feature recycling bins.
nlp_summary:
As it aims to further burnish its environmental credentials, McDonald‚Äôs says it will make its packaging 100 percent green by 2025.
The global fast-food giant on Tuesday announced plans to make all of its consumer packaging out of renewable, recyclable and certified materials within seven years.
‚ÄúOur customers have told us that packaging waste is the top environmental issue they would like us to address,‚Äù Francesca DeBiase, McDonald‚Äôs sustainability officer, said in a statement.
By 2025 our goals are to recycle guest packaging at all McDonald‚Äôs restaurants, recognizing infrastructure challenges, and that 100% of guest packaging will come from renewable, recycled or certified sources: https://t.co/bArjXT6dbw #ScaleForGood pic.twitter.com/LzC5cwbYc4 ‚Äî McDonald's (@McDonaldsCorp) January 16, 2018The plans to go green follow a number of previous environmentally-friendly steps made by the company, including a recent vow to eliminate foam packaging from its global supply chain by the end of 2018.
Since joining forces with the Environmental Defense Fund in 1990, McDonald‚Äôs says it has eliminated more than 300 million pounds of packaging, recycled 1 million tons of corrugated boxes and reduced waste by 30 percent.

title: Trump's 'Fear Of Being Poisoned' Reportedly Fuels His McDonald's Habit
description: He likes "safely premade" food, according to a new tell-all book about the White House.
nlp_summary:
For President Donald Trump, McDonald‚Äôs is to food as Fox News is to TV channels ‚Äï just the best in the field.
Trump has praised the fast food giant‚Äôs ‚Äúgreat‚Äù products and general ‚Äúcleanliness.‚Äù Now a new book suggests there‚Äôs another, darker factor fueling his McDonald‚Äôs habit.
In a preview of his tell-all book, Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House, journalist Michael Wolff claims that Trump‚Äôs ‚Äúlongtime fear of being poisoned‚Äù has affected his dining choices.
It‚Äôs not clear if the president believed a specific person or group was out to harm him.
The revelation about Trump‚Äôs poison concerns is just one of the fascinating assertions Wolff makes in his soon-to-be-released book.

title: Pilot Finds Colleague's Poignant Note Left In Plane Grounded At Start Of Pandemic
description: ‚ÄúIf you are here to pick it up then the light must be at the end of the tunnel," read a message from a Delta pilot that was found 435 days later.
nlp_summary:
A Delta Air Lines pilot left a note on board an aircraft he placed in storage at the start of the coronavirus pandemic, and the message was discovered earlier this month as the plane was prepared for flight once again.
First Officer Chris Dennis tucked a letter into a cockpit tray table on the Airbus A321 he parked at Southern California Logistics Airport in March 2020.
The desert location was used to temporarily house hundreds of aircraft that were grounded during the global health crisis.
‚ÄúHe had to have been thinking he was leaving his job,‚Äù Perez said of Dennis in a statement released by Delta.
‚ÄúBack in March, I was 100% certain I was going to lose my job.‚Äù‚ÄúI kept thinking about my mindset now compared to his when he left this note,‚Äù Perez added.

title: Delta Air Lines Flight Diverted After Passenger Tries To Break Into Cockpit
description: The Los Angeles to Nashville flight made an emergency landing in Albuquerque after other passengers and crew zip-tied the man.
nlp_summary:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) ‚Äî A flight from Los Angeles to Nashville was diverted to New Mexico on Friday afternoon after a passenger tried to break into the cockpit, Delta Air Lines said.
The ‚Äúunruly‚Äù man made the unsuccessful attempt on the locked cockpit aboard Delta Air Lines Flight 386 but other passengers and crew managed to detain him, the airline said.
‚ÄúThe plane landed safely and the passenger was removed by police and the FBI.
He is in custody now,‚Äù Delta said in a statement.
Frank Fisher, spokesman for the FBI in Albuquerque, confirmed that the agency had responded to a report of a plane diverted to the city‚Äôs airport but said there had been no threat to the public.

Only 13 tickets were sold under the deal, which provided a discount for NRA members traveling to the group‚Äôs annual convention in May, The Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported Friday.

title: Cineplex Faces Counter-suit In Fight Over Scrapped $2.8-Billion Takeover
description: The Canadian company is suing Cineworld for backing out of a deal.
nlp_summary:
Analysts say they expect Cineworld to buy Cineplex on "revised terms" after the former backed out of a takeover deal.
Cineworld said Monday it planned to make a counter-claim against Cineplex following the Canadian cinema chain‚Äôs legal action against the British group for damages after it scrapped a $2.8-billion takeover.
Cineplex said last week it was suing Cineworld for damages, including about $2.18 billion that Cineworld would have paid on closing of the deal.
The British company abandoned the takeover last month, citing what it termed the Canadian company‚Äôs breaches in the merger agreement.
‚ÄúCineworld intends to counter-claim against Cineplex for these damages and losses.‚ÄùCineplex has denied these claims.

title: Cineplex Is Reopening After Deep Losses During Pandemic
description: Yes, there will still be popcorn. No, there won't be packed auditoriums.
nlp_summary:
JHVEPhoto via Getty Images A Cineplex Cinemas movie theatre in Oakville, Ont.
Cineplex Inc., Canada‚Äôs largest movie theatre chain, is reopening some of its theatres in July after closing in mid-March when the COVID-19 pandemic struck.
The theatre chain is implementing physical distancing and health measures to reopen during the pandemic.
The theatre chain is also mandating that all staff wear masks and gloves, though guests aren‚Äôt required to.
Despite the deep first-quarter losses ‚Äî revenue tumbled $282.8 million from $364.6 million, while attendance plunged to 10.7 million from nearly 15 million ‚Äî Van Lange said Cineplex is not hiking ticket prices.

title: Cineplex Execs Take 80% Pay Cut As Company Slashes Staff
description: The company plans to rehire when the crisis passes, but for now, it's layoffs and pay cuts.
nlp_summary:
Cinema chain Cineplex says its executives are taking an 80-per-cent pay cut as the company slashes staff and wages amid the coronavirus shutdown.
It says it has laid off ‚Äúthousands‚Äù of part-time workers as a result fo the shutdown.
A spokesperson declined to answer exactly how many part-time staff were laid off, but said it impacted thousands of roles.
The company had about 11,180 part-time employees in the U.S. and Canada as of Dec. 31, 2018, according to its latest annual information form.
While the company intends to rehire the laid off workers when it reopens, the spokesperson said the company is also working with other retailers who need more staff to find them jobs.

description: In the U.S., where gun violence is much more common, the military has warned of a possible mass shooting.

Props and toys ‚Äúwill be reviewed on an individual basis.‚ÄùLandmark Cinemas, Canada‚Äôs second-largest movie distributor, is unconnected to the American Landmark Theatre chain, which announced last week it would ban ‚ÄúJoker‚Äù costumes.

‚ÄúI see in ‚ÄòJoker‚Äô an attempt to elevate nerdy revenge to the plane of myth,‚Äù David Edelstein wrote in Vulture.

title: 'Unplanned' Anti-Abortion Movie Will Come To Canada, But Only Briefly
description: Filmmakers had initially stated the movie would get a "major Canadian release."
nlp_summary:
Unplanned A scene from the anti-abortion movie "Unplanned."
After a struggle to find distribution, the anti-abortion movie ‚ÄúUnplanned‚Äù will in fact be screened in mainstream Canadian movie theatres ‚Äî but only in a few limited markets, and only for one week.
‚ÄúWe of course understand and can appreciate the concerns some have expressed about this film,‚Äù Cineplex spokesperson Sarah Van Lange told HuffPost Canada.
‚ÄúThe idea of a major release based on a timeline is not what the filmmakers were referencing,‚Äù Carmel‚Äôs president Lisa Wheeler told HuffPost Canada in an email.

title: Cineplex Faces Counter-suit In Fight Over Scrapped $2.8-Billion Takeover
description: The Canadian company is suing Cineworld for backing out of a deal.
nlp_summary:
Analysts say they expect Cineworld to buy Cineplex on "revised terms" after the former backed out of a takeover deal.
Cineworld said Monday it planned to make a counter-claim against Cineplex following the Canadian cinema chain‚Äôs legal action against the British group for damages after it scrapped a $2.8-billion takeover.
Cineplex said last week it was suing Cineworld for damages, including about $2.18 billion that Cineworld would have paid on closing of the deal.
The British company abandoned the takeover last month, citing what it termed the Canadian company‚Äôs breaches in the merger agreement.
‚ÄúCineworld intends to counter-claim against Cineplex for these damages and losses.‚ÄùCineplex has denied these claims.

title: Cineplex Is Reopening After Deep Losses During Pandemic
description: Yes, there will still be popcorn. No, there won't be packed auditoriums.
nlp_summary:
JHVEPhoto via Getty Images A Cineplex Cinemas movie theatre in Oakville, Ont.
Cineplex Inc., Canada‚Äôs largest movie theatre chain, is reopening some of its theatres in July after closing in mid-March when the COVID-19 pandemic struck.
The theatre chain is implementing physical distancing and health measures to reopen during the pandemic.
The theatre chain is also mandating that all staff wear masks and gloves, though guests aren‚Äôt required to.
Despite the deep first-quarter losses ‚Äî revenue tumbled $282.8 million from $364.6 million, while attendance plunged to 10.7 million from nearly 15 million ‚Äî Van Lange said Cineplex is not hiking ticket prices.

title: Cineplex Execs Take 80% Pay Cut As Company Slashes Staff
description: The company plans to rehire when the crisis passes, but for now, it's layoffs and pay cuts.
nlp_summary:
Cinema chain Cineplex says its executives are taking an 80-per-cent pay cut as the company slashes staff and wages amid the coronavirus shutdown.
It says it has laid off ‚Äúthousands‚Äù of part-time workers as a result fo the shutdown.
A spokesperson declined to answer exactly how many part-time staff were laid off, but said it impacted thousands of roles.
The company had about 11,180 part-time employees in the U.S. and Canada as of Dec. 31, 2018, according to its latest annual information form.
While the company intends to rehire the laid off workers when it reopens, the spokesperson said the company is also working with other retailers who need more staff to find them jobs.

nlp_summary: Dean Winters _ who for years has played “Mayhem,” the walking whirlwind of chaos in Allstate insurance commercials _ knows plenty about the unexpected that can befall a person in real life.

title: Up In Smoke: Home Insurance Is Getting Too Hard To Find In Wildfire Country
description: ‘It doesn’t matter if they cut every tree and bush on their property, we would not insure it because of where it sits.’
nlp_summary: The insurer, Allstate, had concluded — after an assessor visited the property — that the house was too likely to be destroyed by a wildfire. Cook, a tech executive and recent transplant from the San Francisco Bay Area, said his reaction was something like, “Wait, what?!”
